## About Me

I am a 4th-year Ph.D. candidate in Economics at the University of California, Merced. My research studies how leadership, institutions, and incentives shape innovation and knowledge production. Prior to beginning my doctoral studies, I worked as a data analyst in the San Francisco Bay Area. Outside of research, I enjoy running, reading, and spending time outdoors.

## Research Interests

- Applied Microeconomics
- Economics of Science
- Leadership
